info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 8:12AM CDT until May 30 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney.
* WHEN...From this morning to Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, The creek remains mostly within its banks in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. Some high stages on small feeder streams result in very localized... short-term overflows of mainstem bottomlands. Low-lying fields are briefly cut off from easy access.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 22.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 26.0 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 25.5 feet early Wednesday morning. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO FRIDAY MORNING
